title: ICE when using extern enum variant as a type
body:
The following and various modifications of it cause an ICE. It doesn't need to be in a pattern. It also crashes if it's a value. Normal error is reported if the enum is local.

``` rust
extern crate rustc;

use rustc::lint::*;

fn main() {
}

enum X {
    A,
    Y(i32),
    B,
}
pub use self::X::*;

fn panics() {
    let Y::Uiae(asdf) = 99;
    let Node::Garblegab(Blubber) = 42;
}
```

backtrace (not of the simplified case above, but of the original case I had)

```

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
```
